00022 // Maintains value information about live variables. If a given variable may have more than one value,
00023 //    this object maintains divisibility information about all the possible values (i.e. they're all divisible 
00024 //    by x, with y as the remainder), with the divisior,remainder = (1,0) if nothing better can be found.
00025 // There is one DivLattice object for every variable
00026 class DivLattice : public FiniteLattice
00027 {
00028         private:
00029         // the current value of the variable (if known)
00030         long value;
00031         // the <divisor, remainder> pair where for all possible values v of the variable
00032         // there exists a multiplier m s.t v = div * m + rem
00033         long div;
00034         long rem;
00035                 
00036         public:
00037         // The different levels of this lattice
00038         // no information is known about the value of the variable
00039         static const int bottom=1; 
00040         // the value of the variable is known
00041         static const int valKnown=2; 
00042         // value is unknown but the divisibility (div and rem) of this variable is known 
00043         static const int divKnown=3; 
00044         // this variable holds more values than can be represented using a single value and divisibility
00045         static const int top=4; 
00046         
00047         private:
00048         // this object's current level in the lattice: (bottom, valKnown, divKnown, top)
00049         short level;
00050         
00051         public:
00052         
00053         DivLattice()
00054         {
00055                 value=0;
00056                 div=-1;
00057                 rem=-1;
00058                 level=bottom;
00059         }
00060         
00061         DivLattice(long value) {
00062                 this->value = value;
00063                 div = -1;
00064                 rem = -1;
00065                 level = valKnown;
00066         }
00067         
00068         DivLattice(long div, long rem) {
00069                 value = 0;
00070                 this->div = div;
00071                 this->rem = rem;
00072                 level = divKnown;
00073         }
00074         
00075         DivLattice(const DivLattice& that)
00076         {
00077                 this->value = that.value;
00078                 this->div   = that.div;
00079                 this->rem   = that.rem;
00080                 this->level = that.level;
00081         }
00082         
00083         // initializes this Lattice to its default state
00084         void initialize()
00085         { }
00086         
00087         // returns a copy of this lattice
00088         Lattice* copy() const;
00089         
00090         // overwrites the state of this Lattice with that of that Lattice
00091         void copy(Lattice* that);
00092         
00093         // returns true if the given value matches the given div, rem combo and false otherwise
00094         static bool matchDiv(long value, long div, long rem);
00095         
00096         // Takes two lattices at level divKnown. If the two objects have matching div, rem pairs, returns
00097         // true and sets div and rem to those mathching values. Otherwise, returns false;
00098         static bool matchDiv(DivLattice* one, DivLattice* two, long& div, long& rem);
00099         
00100         // Takes two lattices at level divKnown. If the two objects have div, rem pairs that make it
00101         // possible to add or subtract them them and produce div/rem information where div>1, 
00102         // returns true and sets div and rem to correspond to the sum of these values.
00103         // Otherwise, returns false.
00104         // plus - true if the caller want to see one+two and false if one-two
00105         static bool matchDivAddSubt(DivLattice* one, DivLattice* two, long& div, long& rem, bool plus);
00106         
00107         // computes the meet of this and that and saves the result in this
00108         // returns true if this causes this to change and false otherwise
00109         bool meetUpdate(Lattice* that);
00110         
00111         // computes the meet of this and that and returns the result
00112         //Lattice* meet(Lattice* that) const;
00113         
00114         bool operator==(Lattice* that);
00115         
00116         /*// widens this from that and saves the result in this
00117         // returns true if this causes this to change and false otherwise
00118         bool widenUpdate(InfiniteLattice* that);*/
00119         
00120         // returns the current state of this object
00121         long getValue() const;
00122         long getDiv() const;
00123         long getRem() const;
00124         short getLevel() const;
00125         
00126         // Sets the state of this lattice to bottom
00127         // returns true if this causes the lattice's state to change, false otherwise
00128         bool setBot();
00129         
00130         // Sets the state of this lattice to the given value.
00131         // returns true if this causes the lattice's state to change, false otherwise
00132         bool set(long value);
00133         
00134         // Sets the state of this lattice to the given div/rem state.
00135         // returns true if this causes the lattice's state to change, false otherwise
00136         bool set(long div, long rem);
00137         
00138         // Sets the state of this lattice to top
00139         // returns true if this causes the lattice's state to change, false otherwise
00140         bool setTop();
00141         
00142         // Increments the state of this object by increment
00143         // returns true if this causes the lattice's state to change, false otherwise
00144         bool incr(long increment);
00145         
00146         // Multiplies the state of this object by value
00147         // returns true if this causes the lattice's state to change, false otherwise
00148         bool mult(long multiplier);
00149                 
00150         std::string str(std::string indent="");
00151 };
00152

00154 {

00191   void visit(SgMinusMinusOp *sgn);

00194   bool finish() { return modified; }
00195

00199 class DivAnalysis : public IntraFWDataflow
00200 {
00201         protected:
00202         static std::map<varID, Lattice*> constVars;
00203         static bool constVars_init;
00204         
00205         // The LiveDeadVarsAnalysis that identifies the live/dead state of all application variables.
00206         // Needed to create a FiniteVarsExprsProductLattice.
00207         LiveDeadVarsAnalysis* ldva; 
00208         
00209         public:
00210         DivAnalysis(LiveDeadVarsAnalysis* ldva)
00211         {
00212                 this->ldva = ldva;
00213         }
00214         
00215         /*// generates the initial variable-specific lattice state for a dataflow node
00216         Lattice* genInitVarState(const Function& func, const DataflowNode& n, const NodeState& state);  
00217         
00218         // generates the initial non-variable-specific lattice state for a dataflow node
00219         Lattice* genInitNonVarState(const Function& func, const DataflowNode& n, const NodeState& state);*/
00220         
00221         // generates the initial lattice state for the given dataflow node, in the given function, with the given NodeState
00222         //std::vector<Lattice*> genInitState(const Function& func, const DataflowNode& n, const NodeState& state);
00223         void genInitState(const Function& func, const DataflowNode& n, const NodeState& state,
00224                           std::vector<Lattice*>& initLattices, std::vector<NodeFact*>& initFacts);
00225         
00226         // Returns a map of special constant variables (such as zeroVar) and the lattices that correspond to them
00227         // These lattices are assumed to be constants: it is assumed that they are never modified and it is legal to 
00228         //    maintain only one copy of each lattice may for the duration of the analysis.
00229         //std::map<varID, Lattice*>& genConstVarLattices() const;
00230                 
00231   bool transfer(const Function& func, const DataflowNode& n, NodeState& state, const std::vector<Lattice*>& dfInfo)
00232   { assert(0); return false; }
00233   boost::shared_ptr<IntraDFTransferVisitor> getTransferVisitor(const Function& func, const DataflowNode& n,
00234                                                             NodeState& state, const std::vector<Lattice*>& dfInfo)
00235   { return boost::shared_ptr<IntraDFTransferVisitor>(new DivAnalysisTransfer(func, n, state, dfInfo)); }
00236 };
